title: Gilded Age Expressions
description: Discover the language of America's Gilded Age, an era of rapid wealth and social change (1870s-1900)

questions.question: In the Gilded Age, what was a 'robber baron'?
options: A ruthless and powerful industrialist who amassed great wealth

questions.question: What did the term 'Gilded Age' itself imply?
options: A period that appeared golden on the surface but had serious problems underneath

questions.question: In Gilded Age vocabulary, what was a 'trust'?
options: A combination of companies controlling an entire industry to limit competition

questions.question: What were the 'Four Hundred' during the Gilded Age?
options: The elite list of New York's most prominent socialites

questions.question: In Gilded Age slang, what was a 'muckraker'?
options: A journalist who exposed corruption and social problems

questions.question: What was a 'sweatshop' in Gilded Age America?
options: A factory with long hours, low wages, and poor working conditions

questions.question: In the Gilded Age, what did 'new money' refer to?
options: Recently acquired wealth, as opposed to inherited aristocratic wealth

questions.question: What was a 'tenement' during the Gilded Age?
options: A crowded urban apartment building for low-income families

questions.question: In Gilded Age vocabulary, what was a 'tycoon'?
options: A wealthy and powerful business leader

questions.question: What did 'conspicuous consumption' mean in the Gilded Age?
options: Spending lavishly on luxury goods to display wealth and status

questions.question: In the Gilded Age, what was a 'Pullman car'?
options: A luxurious sleeping car on a railroad train

questions.question: What was 'social Darwinism' in Gilded Age thinking?
options: The belief that the wealthy succeeded due to natural superiority and survival of the fittest

questions.question: In Gilded Age language, what was a 'carpetbagger'?
options: A Northerner who moved South after the Civil War, often for political gain

questions.question: What was a 'cottage' in Gilded Age Newport, Rhode Island?
options: A grand mansion owned by the wealthy elite, modestly called a cottage

questions.question: In the Gilded Age, what did 'captain of industry' describe?
options: A business leader who made great contributions to the economy and society
